value:
With my teacher by my side, I fear
nothing. I will see the battle through
to the end, in this world or any other.

Claude is insufferably inscrutable,
but I must admit he once brightened
many students' monastery days.

Whatever enemies we face... Survive.
Prevail. Do that and we'll witness the
birth of a new world together!

To lead and fight alongside the
Black Eagle Strike Force was one
of the greatest honors of my life.

Gods and mortals stand side by side
with the Order of Heroes. I...will need
to think on this.

I, Edelgard von Hresvelg, Emperor of
Adrestia, bring a message of greeting
to you from $Nf.

I will not rest until every battle is
won—until the long war is over and
a new dawn shines upon the world.

The Adrestian Emperor strides
forward, yielding to nothing and
to no one.
No. This is not enough.

Thank you. This will be of great use
to my cause.

I am Edelgard von Hresvelg, Emperor
of Adrestia. I will liberate my people
from their ancient shackles.

Do you think destiny is decided at
birth, $Nu?$k$pI, for one, believe we can and should
forge our fates with our own hands.$k$pTo be so passive as to allow some
invisible force to dictate our lives
would be ignorant and irresponsible.$k$pI feel that, like my teacher, you have
the power to unlock the potential
in people, $Nu.$k$pI hope you will use that power to help
them stand on their own—to light the
way forward without a need for gods.
てりゃあっ
甘い！
うああっ
不覚だわ…
No mercy.
I won't back down!
I'll cut my own path!
You can't stop me.
I've done...all I can...
Sigh...
The regalia of the Adrestian Emperor is a heavy burden to bear.
I suppose the title of Adrestian Emperor has little significance to you here.
We should feel no obligation to respect traditions purely for their age. Especially if those traditions are wicked.
I will not allow those who slither in the dark to stand in the way of my path.
This world may be the ideal place to study governance. It contains benevolent rulers, despotic tyrants, and everything in between.
My path may demand great personal sacrifice, but it is the only way to achieve real progress.
I have learned—am still learning—much from you. In that way, you have become as important to me as my teacher.
Forward.
Tread carefully.
The choice is clear.
